title.narrative: Refugee and Immigrant Center for Education & Legal Services

description.narrative:
"RAICES seeks to create a national Family Advocate Program (FAP) to address a critical, unmet need of providing legal services to Central American asylum seeking mothers and children legal services after their release from detention.
The goals of the program are as follows: (1) strengthen work with refugee families who have been released from detention or passed through Casa RAICES across; (2) alleviate the serious bottleneck in Houston experienced by legal and care providers there because they do not have the capacity to meet the needs of this population; and (3) reduce the vulnerability of these families to deportation, poor health and discrimination.
In addition to ensuring that all objectives are met, a case manager would match families with community members who can provide support and assistance as the family gets engaged in the long and complicated asylum legal process. UUSC's grant will support the base salary for this position.
Responsibility for these services rests with the full-time case manager; a host of trained volunteers who link with families; the family advocates; and a systematic effort to strengthen the working relationship with the existing collaborative of legal service providers and community-based service agencies."
